1: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,\q
2:
"Can a man be useful to God?\q Can a wise man be useful to him?
\q
3:
Is it any pleasure to the Almighty if you are righteous?\q Is it gain to him if you make your ways blameless?


\q
4:
Is it because of your reverence for him that he rebukes you\q and takes you to judgment?
\q
5:
Is not your wickedness great?\q Is there no end to your iniquities?


\q
6:
For you have demanded guarantee of a loan from your brother for no reason,\q and you have stripped away clothing from the naked.
\q
7:
You have not given water to weary people to drink;\q you have withheld bread from hungry people
\q
8:
although you, a mighty man, possessed the earth,\q although you, an honored man, lived in it.


\q
9:
You have sent widows away empty;\q the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
\q
10:
Therefore, snares are all around you,\q and sudden fear troubles you.
\q
11:
There is darkness, so that you cannot see;\q an abundance of waters covers you.


\q
12:
Is not God in the heights of heaven?\q Look at the height of the stars, how high they are!
\q
13:
You say, 'What does God know?\q Can he judge through the thick darkness?
\q
14:
Thick clouds are a covering to him, so that he does not see us;\q he walks on the vault of heaven.'


\q
15:
Will you keep the old way\q that wicked men have walkedâ€”
\q
16:
those who were snatched away before their time,\q those whose foundations have washed away like a river,
\q
17:
those who said to God, 'Depart from us';\q those who said, 'What can the Almighty do to us?'


\q
18:
Yet he filled their houses with good things;\q the plans of wicked people are far from me.
\q
19:
Righteous people see their fate and are glad;\q innocent people laugh them to scorn.
\q
20:
They say, 'Surely those who rose up against us are cut off;\q fire has consumed their possessions.'


\q
21:
Now agree with God and be at peace with him;\q in that way, good will come to you.
\q
22:
Receive, I beg you, instruction from his mouth;\q store up his words in your heart.


\q
23:
If you return to the Almighty, you will be built up,\q if you put unrighteousness far away from your tents.
\q
24:
Lay your treasure down in the dust,\q the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks,
\q
25:
and the Almighty will be your treasure,\q precious silver to you.


\q
26:
For then you will take pleasure in the Almighty;\q you will lift up your face to God.
\q
27:
You will make your prayer to him, and he will hear you;\q you will pay your vows to him.
\q
28:
You will also decree anything, and it will be confirmed for you;\q light will shine on your paths.


\q
29:
God humbles a proud man,\q and he saves the one with lowered eyes.
\q
30: He will rescue even the man who is not innocent;\q who will be rescued through the cleanness of your hands."
